\pard\cf1\f0\fs24 Verbs with two objects\par
Some verbs that have two objects can make two different active sentences, and so two different passive sentences too:\par
\par
Give\par
Active: He gave me the book / He gave the book to me.\par
You can choose either of the two objects to be the subject of the passive sentence.\par
\par
Passive: I was given the book (by him)/ The book was given to me (by him).\par
Other verbs like this are: ask, offer, teach, tell, lend, promise, sell, throw.\par
\par
\f1\lang1033 My friend has given me a pencil.\f0\lang1049\par
give me your pencil.\f1\lang1033  \f0\lang1049\'e4\'e0\'e9 \'ec\'ed\'e5 \'f1\'e2\'ee\'e9 \'ea\'e0\'f0\'e0\'ed\'e4\'e0\'f8.\par
I was given your pencil. \'ec\'ed\'e5 \'e4\'e0\'eb\'e8 \'f2\'e2\'ee\'e9 \'ea\'e0\'f0\'e0\'ed\'e4\'e0\'f8.\par
\par
She diligently completed each task she was given.\par
}
